The sheer diversity and abundance of wildlife here is unmatched. Marvel at the awe-inspiring Victoria Falls, one of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World, before heading to Botswana’s Chobe National Park, renowned for its vast herds of elephants and spectacular safari experiences. Wander through the vibrant Malay Quarter, known for its brightly painted houses and rich cultural heritage. Visit landmarks like the Castle of Good Hope, the Slave Lodge, and the historic Company Gardens, offering insight into the city’s past. Kruger & Chobe National Park safaris Explore Chobe’s diverse landscapes in search of lions, leopards, and other iconic African wildlife. Witness breathtaking sunsets while watching elephants, hippos, and crocodiles along the Chobe River. Try your luck at catching the legendary tiger fish in one of Africa’s most scenic fishing spots. Victoria Falls Witness the Power of Victoria Falls – Walk through misty rainforest trails and admire breathtaking viewpoints of Main Falls, Horseshoe Falls, Rainbow Falls, and the Boiling Pot. Enjoy a relaxing boat ride while spotting hippos, crocodiles, and elephants along the riverbanks. Experience the sheer beauty and raw power of one of the world’s most awe-inspiring waterfalls. Itinerary Details Day 1: Welcome to Cape Town Upon arrival in Cape Town, you will be greeted and transferred privately to your hotel. In the evening, take some time to explore the lively Victoria & Alfred Waterfront at your leisure. Known for its stunning coastal landscapes and cosmopolitan charm, Cape Town seamlessly blends breathtaking natural beauty with urban sophistication. Day 2: Explore Cape Town’s Icons Today, embark on a half-day city tour, discovering Cape Town’s most famous landmarks and dramatic coastal scenery. Visit the iconic Table Mountain, ascending to the summit via a revolving cable car (weather permitting) to take in panoramic views of the city and coastline. Stroll through Greenmarket Square, one of the city’s oldest markets, and wander the historic Company Gardens, originally established by Dutch settlers in 1652. Other highlights include the Houses of Parliament, the Castle of Good Hope, and the Slave Lodge, offering insight into the city’s layered past. End your tour in the Bo-Kaap, a vibrant Malay Quarter known for its colourful houses and rich cultural heritage. Day 3: Cape Peninsula Adventure After breakfast, set out on a full-day Cape Peninsula excursion. Travel along the scenic Atlantic coastline, passing through Sea Point and Camps Bay, with mesmerising views of the Twelve Apostles mountain range. Visit the Cape Point Nature Reserve, home to a diverse range of indigenous flora and fauna, and witness the breathtaking meeting point of the Atlantic and Indian Oceans. The journey concludes with a visit to the beautiful Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens, nestled against the eastern slopes of Table Mountain. Day 4: From Cape Town to the Wild – Greater Kruger Area After breakfast, board a flight to Kruger National Park. Upon arrival, you will be transferred to a private safari lodge in the Greater Kruger area, an unfenced wilderness adjoining Kruger National Park, where the wildlife roams freely. Spend the next three days immersed in thrilling safari experiences. Days 5 and 6: Safari in the Greater Kruger Area Set out on morning and evening game drives, searching for the Big Five—lion, leopard, elephant, rhino, and buffalo—along with a rich variety of other wildlife. With game drives conducted in both private concessions and Kruger National Park, you will have the chance to witness Africa’s diverse wildlife in their natural habitat. Note: Safari activities may vary depending on your accommodation. Day 7: From the Bush to the Falls – Victoria Falls, Zimbabwe Enjoy one last early morning game drive before breakfast, then transfer to the airport for your flight to Victoria Falls. Upon arrival, you will be transferred to your accommodation in Zimbabwe. Zimbabwe is renowned for its stunning landscapes, world-class safaris, and the majestic Victoria Falls, which it shares with neighboring Zambia. Day 8: Marvel at Victoria Falls This morning, explore one of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World—Victoria Falls. Walk through the misty rainforest trails, stopping at spectacular viewpoints to admire the roaring cascades, including Main Falls, Horseshoe Falls, Rainbow Falls, and the Boiling Pot. After some leisure time at your hotel, embark on a sunset cruise along the Zambezi River, where you can watch hippos, crocodiles, and elephants along the riverbanks as the sun sets over the African wilderness. Days 9 to 11: Safari in Chobe National Park Cross into Botswana for an unforgettable stay in Chobe National Park, famous for its massive elephant herds and incredible wildlife encounters. Enjoy a mix of activities, including game drives, sunset river cruises, and, if available, fishing excursions. Whether you are watching elephants gather at the river’s edge or spotting big cats on a game drive, Chobe offers an immersive safari experience. Note: Activities vary based on your accommodation. Day 12: Farewell to Africa – Transfer to Kasane After breakfast, you will be transferred to Kasane Airport, where your African adventure comes to an end. From here, you can board your onward flight or extend your stay for more exploration. This carefully curated itinerary takes you from the bustling cityscapes of Cape Town to the wild plains of Kruger, the thundering Victoria Falls, and the untamed beauty of Chobe National Park—a once-in-a-lifetime journey through Southern Africa.
